review_body: Fast-paced yarn kept me reading. You could feel the heat, the exhaustion, the sting of knives and bullets, the terror of the unknown in the darkness. Loved the premise, although how a company bought land and got government permits to set up drilling operations practically overnight really stretched credibility. Without giving anything away, some of the story was too predictable. (Gee, why is all that platinum buried three miles down?) I also would have preferred if the story had been told from the perspective of one character, whether hero or anti-hero, but that never really happened. Even the author could not seem to decide if he liked or hated certain key characters. The most heroic had only minor supporting roles and some of them did not fare well. Biggest disappointment was the Hollywood movie ending. How many times have we all seen that ending before? Very convenient way to tidily wrap things up.

review_body: It does protect the Macbook, so that is what its main purpose is and it does that. Where it comes up short... I purchased this projector in March of 2019. The picture quality is great but I could not get YouTube to work, or any other already installed programs to work (like Hulu etc). I had to purchase the Roku fire stick to watch tv on it. No biggie. 6 months later I got a huge black blob on the screen we couldn’t fix and the fan was making a loud noise. Turns out that the LCD was defective. I sent a message to the company and told them about my issue and they sent me replacement parts for the projector along with instructions on how to replace them, FREE of charge. Although I’m not super thrilled about the issue we had with the projector, the customer service I received was top notch. I was corresponding with a customer service agent who treated me with the upmost respect and was very understanding. I’m not sure if I would buy this specific projector again, knowing what I know now but I’m confident that if I have any more issues, I’m going to get the help I need. Hope this helps!

review_body: 5 stars for the story, 1 for the format. Too many of the letters were the book-author talking to the book-reader, not character to character. The entire thing would have worked better - 'I had to read it as' to get through it - journal entries with a framing story. Perhaps they give their journals to their son for a birthday, and he edits then together chronologically for their anniversary, a la How I Met Your Mother. The letter format just doesn't work for scenes where the letter writer and letter reader are in the time-space. It barely works - the level of detail makes it vaguely problematic - when they're apart.

Luckily the clip on the back is independent from it and remained on the unit. I do like that they send you 4 though. The retractable holders I've bought over the years usually give out within a year. I hope these last longer. I make multiple pulls a day as my job requires it.

These floor mats fit my 2016 RAV4 like they were built by Toyota. The material is durable and the lips around the edges allow them to collect dirt and debris. The only flaw I found was the texture on the trunk mat. I was hoping for something that had a little more friction. As is, my groceries slide all over the place on the slick surface. This would be a good thing if you have something heavy, say a big tent, cooler full of ice and drinks, and large luggage that you want to set on the edge and slide to the back of the vehicle. In that case, you don't want sticky friction making it more difficult. That is a rare case for me, as I am more likely to throw a cart full of groceries back there. That type of texture would have made it difficult to clean too, which I can appreciate. I like the texture on the rest of the floor mats where it makes sense. It is enough of a problem for me that I removed a star. I also removed a star because they are extremely expensive! I would have liked to see them more around $150 - $175. But I still bought them, and I do HOPE they last for the life of the vehicle, in which case, it is a worthy investment. If I have to replace them in 5 years, the cost would then be unreasonable. Overall, I highly recommend these floor mats to anyone looking to protect their 2016 RAV4 floors. They are very expensive and things in the trunk do slide around too much, but you won't find a better fit or better protection I think. 3/5 stars. If you found this review helpful, please show some love by clicking the "Yes" button below. It really helps me to know what reviews you guys and gals like! Thanks for reading!
review_title: Perfect fit for 2016 RAV4, but very expensive and needs grip in trunk area

review_body: I was so torn on this book. I wanted to feel it. I wanted to believe the passion, but it just wasn't there. The first 30 or 40% was so SLOW and boring, I had to stop reading, but ended up coming back to it. I'll be honest, I skimmed a lot of this book. A LOT. I just couldn't feel the characters at all and it felt like a filler book? Do you know what I mean? I'm seeing this more and more with these authors that pump out books every 3 months. Sure it makes them money, but their books are a hit or miss with me. It seems as if this was in the miss checklist. It felt like the story was slow but the concept rushed. I know that probably makes no sense, but read it and see. If you are a new to Michaels, don't go for this one right away. Try some of her earlier works.

I'd like to say "wow, love these" but I can't. It wouldn't take much to turn these into great bibs and I would have paid a bit more to get it. These are better than most $40 bibs, yes, and they are a lot worse than $180 bibs. I'd have rather paid a little more to get a couple minor improvements and then the difference between these and $180 bibs would have been far less and this would be a 5 star review. So where's the area for improvements: 1) In this price range a gel chamois is expected or at least something approximating that sort of density. Sadly I didn't see that in the description it says "foam" padding. That's just lame. It really doesn't do much of anything padding wise. 2) While I'm sure it helps from a coolness factor, the bib straps are just too flimsy a material. It isn't the same as the rest of the shorts so it really doesn't pull the shorts up and keep them in position. Better than a drawstring at the waist but just not as functional as a bib should be. If you want bibs that would be great for relatively short rides (padding not so important) in hot weather, these would be ok, but they really aren't up there for more substantial rides.

The only benefit is the medicine i think goes all the way to the edge so its slightly easier getting the smaller patches to fit over larger pimples, where as the other brand the medicine was in the middle and sometimes Id not get the patch quite centered. The sheets are not perforated so you have to carful pull the patch off with your fingernails and hope you dont mess up the edge. These patches work pretty much like the other brand I bought before. Some times they work over night, sometimes i have to use multiple patches back to back and sometimes they don't work at all, mostly on the deep pimples. These appear quite powerful for their small size, they shoot out a visibly large amount of steam. But, don’t let the amount of steam coming out fool you, it is super dispersed, even if you hold your hand right above the steam, it will never condense on your hand. Compared to a real humidifier, if you place your hand above the steam, your hand will get wet, meaning it’s actually putting out much more water than these things. You’d probably have to have these running for a few hours to elevate humidity compared to a good humidifier running for 30 minutes. For a diffuser they’re perfect, as a humidifier a solid NEGATIVE! I have an electronic RH (relative humidity) meter, and these barely raised the RH by less than 5%. I only bought these to help my tropical plants in summer, and even then, humidity never went past 45%. But since I live in the California desert, I will take any humidity increase I can. The lights are also pretty cool, with a large variety to choose from. The wood design is a little on the cheap looking side though, but for the price I’d say it’s worth it.

Just like some earlier reviews have claimed, my clip broke apart from the base. I thought maybe I did something wrong while handling it but nope! It just came right apart. I figured since it was so inexpensive that there was no point in returning it, so I got some super heavy adhesive and glued it back together. Not what I would have preferred but atleast I knew that it wouldn't come apart again. It fit my Pop Socket and once I figured out the optimal placement for it on my air vent, the product worked fine. It does take two hands to clip your phone in and to take it out but it does provide a pretty snug fit.
